events.event_description: U.S. weekly average gasoline prices declined to $3.48/gallon, falling 19 cents from the 2024 high and 5 cents lower than the previous year.
events.citation: Weekly U.S. average gasoline prices have declined 19 cents per gallon (gal) since the 2024 high on April 22, falling to $3.48/gal on July 1, five cents/gal less than the price a year ago.

events.event_description: U.S. gasoline inventories increased by 7.1 million barrels, with East Coast seeing an unseasonable increase of 4.1 million barrels.
events.citation: Between April 19 and June 21 (the most recent week available), U.S. gasoline inventories increased by 7.1 million barrels to 233.9 million barrels, essentially equal to the previous five-year average. The increase has been driven by unseasonably large inventory growth in the East Coast, which increased by 4.1 million barrels over the same period.

events.event_description: East Coast gasoline imports increased significantly from 381,000 barrels per day to 630,000 barrels per day, primarily from Europe.
events.citation: Gasoline imports into the East Coast hit a 2024 low of 381,000 barrels per day (b/d) the week of April 5 but increased after that and averaged 630,000 b/d the week of June 21, a 65% increase.

events.event_description: Dated Brent crude oil prices reached 2024 high of $93 per barrel due to Red Sea shipping risks and OPEC+ production cuts.
events.citation: The price of Dated Brent crude oil, an international benchmark, reached a 2024 high of $93 per barrel (b) on April 12 before falling to $76/b on June 5. Crude oil prices in early April were driven by heightened geopolitical risk related to ships transiting the Red Sea and general elevated tensions in the Middle East, along with an OPEC+ announcement to extend production cuts.

events.event_description: U.S. Department of Energy announced sale of 1 million barrels from Northeast Gasoline Supply Reserve.
events.citation: On May 21, 2024, the U.S. Department of Energy's Office of Petroleum Reserves announced a solicitation for the sale of 1 million barrels of gasoline from the NGSR.
